laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial hematocrit was 22.4%, rose to 26.1% after first admission, then 22.9% after second admission, and remained at 22.4% during cancer center evaluation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hematocrit levels fluctuated: increased after transfusions but showed a decline at subsequent evaluations.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Hemoglobin was 7.5 g/dL during initial admission, rose to 8.7 g/dL after first admission and remained at 7.5 g/dL during the second and third admissions.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant changes in hemoglobin levels over time, consistent at 7.5 g/dL in later evaluations.

laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count was 7400, decreased to 5400, then increased to 6300 and finally to 6600 during cancer center evaluation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased white-cell count over time from initial admission through cancer center evaluation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Platelet counts were 380,000, decreased to 281,000, rose to 427,000, and then decreased to 388,000.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Fluctuated over time, but remained within normal range.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mean corpuscular volume was 110 at initial admission and remained elevated at 110 during subsequent evaluations, decreased to 99 during cancer center evaluation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Consistently high until the cancer center evaluation where a decrease was noted.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Erythrocyte count was 2,040,000 at first admission, rose to 2,370,000, and then to 2,250,000.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially increased then decreased at the final evaluation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Reticulocyte percentage was 2.2% at the initial tests.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Stable at 2.2%, indicating no significant change.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Prothrombin time was 13.2 seconds at first admission, increased to 14.1 seconds, then 19.3 seconds, and finally to 21.2 seconds.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: International normalized ratio for prothrombin time
laboratory_examinations.findings: INR was 1.4 at first admission, increased to 2.5 and then to 3.1.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: INR levels increased, indicating worsening anticoagulation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Lactate dehydrogenase was elevated at 301 U/liter at first admission and increased to 343 U/liter.
Initial samples showed normal marrow cellularity with dysplasia in subsequent evaluations indicating progression.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial normal findings progressed to dysplasia and increased blasts over time.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially showed del(5)(q13q34), later samples indicated additional chromosomal abnormalities.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression from isolated abnormalities to additional chromosomal changes.
